titleStmt.title: R. S. Boyd et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6188

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thos E Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

Sir the undersigned petitioners would respectfully represent to your excellency that at the February Term of the Livingston circuit court there was a Judgement against One John S Myrick for sixty dollars & costs for keeping a tipling house in said county now sir and we are informed that said Judgement was erroneous from the fact that the name of John S Myrick was substituted for John W Myrick and farther at the time said house was kept the said John S Myrick was not even a citizen of the county the error consists in not having the proper person before the court the said John S Myrick being very ill at the time of said court was unable to defend now in view of the premises we ask your excellency to remit the fine the said Myrick is poor man and as such deserves to be aided this March 4th 1865

R S Boyd
J E Severn (assistant assessor) (Internal revenue
William, H, Adcock
Uriah Trimble
Alexander Stanford
Cass Stanford
Dr Thomas Linley
J P Strane
S. Skelton
J. L. Fleming
C Haynes
Joseph Newman
P. W. Crawford
Haydon Nelson
M T Dunn
J Q Ashbrook
Stephen Kindall
W M Gray
J. W. Cafle
W Beverly
A Joiner

Livingston Cir Ct
vs
John S. Myrick
$50
Keeping Tipling
House
